resources.string:
When this service is enabled, Lightning Launcher will open automatically when you hover the cursor over the App Library icon on the right of dock for about half a second.
(This may make it difficult to access the default launcher)
 
Make sure to enable the "Use Lightning Launcher" switch - the "Lightning Launcher Shortcut" switch won't do anything on the Quest!
Launching 2D apps in a separate window allows for easier multitasking on Quest devices, but will cause certain apps to not always launch.\n\nIf you have any issues, disable this option!

By enabling the shortcut service, Lighting Launcher will open when you hover over the App Library icon on the right of the dock, essentially replacing the default launcher.\n\nAlternatively, you can use the LauncherShortcut apk provided on the GitHub. (Make sure to carefully read the instructions in the README if you choose this option)

1. Use the button to open Android's accessibility settings
2. Click on "Lightning Launcher"
3. Switch the service on (or off) at the top of the page
4. Click "Allow" if you get a prompt
Click a group to move the selected app.
%d apps selected. Click a group to move them.
Update from version %1$s to %2$s, without taking off your headset!
Restart the app to try again. If you got a Problem Staging message, it might take a couple tries.
